wikipedia_page.main:
Lesley Charles (born 15 July 1952) is a former tennis player from the UK. In 1973 and 1975 she competed in the Australian Open.
Charles was a Wimbledon mixed doubles runner-up in 1974, with compatriot Mark Farrell, losing in straight sets to Owen Davidson and Billie Jean King.
In 1974, Charles won 15 doubles titles with Sue Mappin, mainly on the British circuit.

Farrell and Lesley Charles were mixed doubles finalists at the 1974 Wimbledon Championships.ITF Pro Circuit Profile In 1974, he was also a losing finalist at a WCT event in London and represented Great Britain in a Davis Cup tie against Iran. He played the doubles rubber with John Lloyd, and they won.Davis Cup Profile Farrell scored a win against Björn Borg at the 1973 NSW Championships.The Age, "Borg movie plan for Open", 13 July 1978, p. 25 Two years later he scored a victory over Stan Smith at Nottingham.ATP World Tour Profile
